Content.Text:
This is the screen for your bag. The
top screen shows information about the
item selected on the bottom screen.

The item you are currently holding is
outlined in red.

The bottom screen shows a list of
items that are in your bag.

If you want to view lists of items by
category, switch between categories
using the <BLUE>L Button</BLUE> and the <BLUE>R Button</BLUE>.

To equip or place an item, press the
<BLUE>A Button</BLUE> or <BLUE>touch</BLUE> the item.

This is where you choose what to do
with the item you have selected.

The choices include <RED>equip</RED>, <RED>place</RED>, <RED>eat</RED>,
and others. Choose whichever is
appropriate for the situation.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
By the way, edible items have a <RED>quality</RED>
rating assigned to them. It's shown by
the number of <BLUE>stars</BLUE> they have.
<PAGE>
Quality indicates how good an item is.
For example, <RED>a higher quality item
earns more money when shipped</RED>.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Items with different quality ratings are
stored as separate entries in your bag,
so they can take up lots of room.
<PAGE>
If you do run out of room, you can <RED>sort</RED>
by pressing the <BLUE>Y Button</BLUE> on the
bag screen. Let me show you an example.

On the top is what your bag looks like
before sorting. On the bottom is how
it looks after. Much more space, huh?
It's a handy feature, so use it!

But when you sort items, <RED>their quality
will be averaged out</RED>, so be careful
using it if you want to preserve high-
quality items.
